page.title: 03RELIGION
page.content: There has been a Church here since the 12th.century but in the present building only the West Tower is pre-19th.century.It was once called Our Lady of the Island, but is now called St. Mary's. John Richardson has been Vicar here for 10 years. There are 4 or 5 services every Sunday and the Church is shared by the Methodists "I don't think that anything should be done separately that you can't do together":the Vicar. There are 2 Youth Clubs, Guides, Brownies, Cubs, Scouts, 2 Toddlers' Groups and a monthly group for older people.The Vicar also teaches and takes assemblies at St. Mary's School.The Church receives about Â£40,000 in collections of which Â£8,000 is given away immediately, Â£16,000 goes to the Diocese, Â£5,000 to the Church itself.Much of the rest is for heating,lighting and expenses.
